property.displayedProperties: device ip parttype part instance[Instance] pparttyp[Parent Component Type] ppart[Parent Component]
property.description:
Database is the data storage of the network statistics polled by the collecting process. Data aggregation and retention are managed by the backend process. The database type can be either MySQL or Oracle

  • Availability : Average of availability of the database. The availability is computed by opening a JDBC session.
  • Used Space: Current space used by the database.
  • Number of connections: Number of sessions established to the database.
  • Number of records: The number of metrics and properties stored in the database.
  • Hit Query Cache: The query cache stores the text of a SELECT statement together with the corresponding result that was sent to the client. If an identical statement is received later, the server retrieves the results from the query cache rather than parsing and executing the statement again. The query cache is shared among sessions, so a result set generated by one client can be sent in response to the same query issued by another client. Cache Queries metric is percentage of hits in the cache. So higher the percentage is, better is the database efficiency.
  • Number of Queries : Average of total queries received by the database during the time period.

node.name: Total Number of Metrics : Forecast for the current 3 months

property.name: Number Of Metrics
property.description: based on a Metric coming from SQL query : select count(*) from data_variable.

property.displayedProperties: device ip parttype part instance[Instance] pparttyp[Parent Component Type] ppart[Parent Component]

Backends Temp Files Count This report displays the number of temporary EMC M&R files in the backend queue.

property.name: O.S. Total memory (GB)
property.description: • Amount of Physical Memory available on the sever

property.name: Sum of JVM's allocated memory
property.description:
• Sum of all JVM's heap size.
  • Web-Service-Gateway and Task-Scheduler module are excluded.

property.name: % JVM's allocated memory
property.description:
• Percentage of Allocated Memory versus Amount of Physical Memory.
  • If the value is above 100%, it means that you can potentially run into memory issues, if all JVM's requests memory at the same time. This isn't necessary a problem, but you should ensure that you haven't over allocated memory where not needed.

property.name: Subscription (%)
property.description:
• A negative value is excellent. It means that the sum of all JVM's heap size is less than the amount of memory available on the system.
  • If the value is above 0%, it means that you can potentially run into memory issues, if all JVM's requests memory at the same time. This isn't necessary a problem, but you should ensure that you haven't over allocated memory where not needed.
